newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela consortium wins Casma-Anaco oil contract.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela consortium wins Casma-Anaco oil contract.

text.p: A Venezuelan consortium agreed Monday to pay $27.58 million for the contract to operate Venezuela's Casma-Anaco oil field, state oil company Petroleos de Venezuela (PDVSA) said.

The consortium -- made up of Cosa-Ingenieros Consultores, Cartera de Inversiones Venezolanas CA and Phoenix International CA -- was among 13 bidders on the first day of Venezuela's third round of oil operating contract auctions.
A total of 131 companies are competing for 20 contracts and the winners are determined purely by the size of their cash bids.
Under the 20-year contract, the operator will produce hydrocarbons on behalf of PDVSA subsidiary Corpoven in exchange for a fee worked out on a sliding scale.

Discovered in 1972 in eastern Venezuela, Casma-Anaco was one of five fields reserved for Venezuelan operators with a minimum 30 percent stake. It curently produces 1,550 barrels per day. As a condition of the contract, the operator must invest at least $6 million within three years, although PDVSA expects investment to be higher.
